item.title: Recent rstats hashtag
item.description:
library(tidyverse)

library(twitteR)
setup_twitter_oauth(
  consumer_key = token$consumer_key, 
  consumer_secret = token$consumer_secret,
  access_token = token$token, 
  access_secret = token$token_secret
)
#> [1] "Using direct authentication"

Find rstats Hashtag

searchtwit <- searchTwitter("#rstats")

Hashtags appearing with rstats

Note that searchtwit is a list.

  1. Find any non-whitespace pattern after a hashtag.

  2. Remove elements #rstats.

    other_tag <- 
lapply(
searchtwit,
function(x) {
  str_extract_all(
    x$text,
    pattern = "#\\S+"
  ) %>% 
    unlist() %>% 
    str_remove_all(pattern = "[:punct:]$") %>% 
    .[str_to_lower(.) != "#rstats"]
}
) %>% 
unlist()

Make a tibble

(tag_tibble <- tibble(x = other_tag))
#> # A tibble: 79 x 1
#>    x               
#>    <chr>           
#>  1 #Analytics      
#>  2 #DataScience    
#>  3 #AI             
#>  4 #MachineLearning
#>  5 #IoT            
#>  6 #IIoT           
#>  7 #PyTorch        
#>  8 #Python         
#>  9 #RS             
#> 10 #DataEngineering
#> # â€¦ with 69 more rows

tag_tibble %>% 
  count(x) %>% 
  arrange(desc(n))
#> # A tibble: 19 x 2
#>    x                            n
#>    <chr>                    <int>
#>  1 #AI                         11
#>  2 #Analytics                  11
#>  3 #DataScience                11
#>  4 #BigData                    10
#>  5 #MachineLearning             9
#>  6 #IoT                         8
#>  7 #IIoT                        2
#>  8 #Machin                      2
#>  9 #maps                        2
#> 10 #population                  2
#> 11 #rprogramming                2
#> 12 #rstats/#MachineLearning     2
#> 13 #DataEngineering             1
#> 14 #I                           1
#> 15 #NoSQL                       1
#> 16 #Python                      1
#> 17 #PyTorc                      1
#> 18 #PyTorch                     1
#> 19 #RS                          1
